summary: From January 2017 until they were revoked in January 2021, a series of deregulatory executive orders required agencies to reduce federal regulations and overall regulatory costs. We reviewed five agencies that collectively implemented more than half of the deregulation. All of them reported mostly using existing regulatory processes to implement the executive orders. All five agencies stated that they would have likely finalized the deregulatory...
title: Federal Rulemaking: Deregulatory Executive Orders Did Not Substantially Change Selected Agencies' Processes or Procedures
